Description: Landscape painter utilizing traditional oils; known for minimalist, luminous skyscapes and paintings that serve as meditations rather than narrative backdrops,,.
Glass artist known for the 'incalmo' (double-bubble) technique and symmetrical vessels that emphasize the interplay of color and light,,.
Painter working with acrylics and polymers on large-scale surfaces; known for a process of 'planned abandon' focusing on surface and texture,.
Acrylic painter known for works inspired by the open road, such as the 'Cruise Control' series,.
Sculptor and painter educated at the Art Institute of Chicago; known for bronzes, pastels, and Western themes, particularly those depicting the Tarahumara people,,.
Renowned glass artist known for the 'Seaform' series and large-scale installations,.
Artist working in acrylic on paper, known for works such as 'Red Plains',.
Painter and weaver; works in oil, pastel, and acrylic gel; focuses on the 'aliveness' in still life and the interplay of light and dark,,.
Known as 'The Frogman,' a British master artist who creates bronze sculptures of frogs using the lost wax method,.
Watercolorist known for works such as 'Runner'.
Sculptor specializing in bronze wildlife figures, such as 'Masai Majesty' and 'Gentle Giant'.
Watercolorist and Associate Professor specializing in still life and realism.
Painter and functional art designer; abstract impressionist landscapes inspired by nature's landforms using oils and palette knives.
'Light and Space' artist using neon, cement, glass, and indigenous materials; influenced by Rauschenberg and earthworks,,.
Pop Art and Neo-Dada artist known for 'Happenings' and the use of everyday objects (robes, tools) in painting, printmaking, and sculpture,,.
Artist known for a unique style of collage and engraving (Collographs), often creating intense blocks of color with musical themes.
Figurative realist painter influenced by the Italian Renaissance, anatomy, and mythological themes,.
Self-taught artist specializing in fiber sculpture and mixed-media; known for the 'Spirit Keepers' series inspired by tribal folklore,.
Oil and encaustic painter creating 'visual poetry' and landscapes luminous and organic in nature,.
Painter and printmaker working in color intaglio and aquatint; explores forms and geometry akin to musical structures,.
Mixed media artist and painter (miniatures and large scale) often exploring biological, botanical, and anatomical themes,.
Painter who uses a wet-in-wet watercolor technique to depict rural life and social statements regarding the environment,.
Sculptor known for bronze figures, such as the piece 'Rio',.
Visionary artist from the Pacific Northwest; known for metaphysical nature paintings rooted in solitude and Zen Buddhism.
Master artist and stamp designer who rebuilt his career in Portland, Oregon after fleeing war in Iraq; known for capturing colorful scenes of daily life,.
Oil painter using a blend of realism and impressionism; known for landscapes and garden scenes,,.
French artist working in oils, known for 'Couleurs d'Automne',.
Watercolor and oil painter recognized for capturing the life of Native people in Peru.
Painter and professor at the University of Washington; known for his 'Burpee Garden' series and squeeze-bottle painting technique.
Sculptor working in bronze, known for wildlife pieces like 'Squirrel Curl'.
Watercolor painter known for depictions of the American West, album covers, and murals,.
Ceramist and art instructor known for large, hand-built earthen vessels and burnished terra-cotta,.
Glass artist and former gaffer for Chihuly; renowned for vessels exploring archeological and mythological themes using unique surface treatments,,.
Sculptor known for sleek, abstract animal figures (particularly cats) created in bronze, wood, and marble,,.
Post-Macchiaioli painter who depicted the proletarian neighborhoods of Livorno and cabaret scenes.
Sculptor working in bronze, known for creating functional art such as bronze tables,.
Painter and printmaker known for a surreal Pop Art interpretation of Cubism and carborundum etchings,.
Major 20th-century artist; printmaker and painter; creator of the 'Vollard Suite' featuring the Minotaur motif,,.
Sculptor and painter residing in Walla Walla, WA; creates animals surrounded by emblems of the human condition,.
Celebrated French sculptor.
Ceramic sculptor influenced by time in Paris and Brazil; known for brightly colored, whimsical figures and low-fire ceramics,.
Ceramicist who creates wheel-thrown clay baskets designed to emulate authentic Indian woven baskets,.
Glass artist associated with the Pilchuck Glass School; known for blown, painted, etched, and faceted glass vessels,.
Painter known for contemporary landscapes, architectural themes, and the 'Continuum' series,.
Watercolor artist based in Japan, known for works such as 'Dragon Vase with Constellation'.
Hopi-Tewa potter and great-grandchild of Grace Chapella; known for traditional ceramics and butterfly designs,.
Painter and carborundum etcher; themes include exile, women, and biblical stories; influenced by surrealism,.
Abstract sculptor; apprentice to Henry Moore; known for 'New Generation' sculpture using fiberglass and poured bronze,.
Artist specializing in metal wall sculptures, including large-scale abstract school of fish installations,.
